front.title: The MEMO Message Type for BGP-4

abstract.t: This document defines the BGP-4 MEMO Message and MEMO Capability to facilitate the exchange of session-specific human-oriented information between network operators.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in .

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines the BGP-4 MEMO Message and MEMO Capability to facilitate the exchange of human-oriented information specific to the BGP-4 session through which the MEMO is distributed. In concept this enhancement is similar to the dissemination of plan files, and not intended for real-time communication.

section.title: Protocol Extensions
section.t: The BGP protocol extensions introduced in this document include the definition of a new BGP capability, named "MEMO Capability", and the specification of the MEMO message.

section.title: MEMO Capability
section.t: The "Support for MEMO Message Capability" is a new BGP capability. The Length field of this capability MUST be set to 1. The Capability value MUST be set to the version of the MEMO message supported by the BGP speaker. This document only defines MEMO version 1 messages.

By advertising this capability to a peer, a BGP speaker conveys to the peer that the speaker supports receiving MEMO messages, indicates what version of the MEMO message it supports, and supports the related procedures described in this document.

section.title: MEMO Message
section.t: A MEMO message is composed of one or more key-value pairs. A MEMO message MUST NOT contain more than 16 key-value pairs. Each key and each value field MUST be proceeded by a one octet Length field to indicate the length of the subsequent field. MEMO key fields have a REQUIRED maximum length of 32 octets. MEMO value fields have a REQUIRED maximum length of 128 octets. To support international characters, both key and value fields MUST be encoded using UTF-8. Fields are not NUL terminated.

section.title: Error Handling
section.t: This document defines a new NOTIFICATION error code: "MEMO Message Error". The following new error subcode is defined as well: "Invalid Message Length".
The error handling specified in this section is applicable only when a BGP speaker has received the "Support for MEMO Message Capability" from a peer.

All errors detected while processing the MEMO message MUST be indicated by sending the NOTIFICATION message with the Error Code MEMO Message Error. The error subcode elaborates on the specific nature of the error.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: IANA is requested to assign value TBD1 (MEMO) in the "BGP Message Types" subregistry under the "Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Parameters" registry.
IANA is requested to assign value TBD2 (MEMO Message Error) in the "BGP Error (Notification) Codes" subregistry under the "Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Parameters" registry.

IANA is requested to create a new registry "MEMO Message Error subcodes" for error subcodes, under the "BGP Error Subcodes" subregistry under the "Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Parameters" registry. The Registration Procedure for this new registry is "First Come First Served". IANA is requested to assign value TBD3 (Invalid Message Length) in this new error subcode registry.
IANA is requested to assign value TBD4 (Support for MEMO Message Capability) in the "Capability Codes" registry.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This document uses UTF-8 encoding for the MEMO message. UNICODE TR36 to learn about these
